transportAdvice: Montreal has an extensive metro and bus network that covers most tourist areas, making it easy to get around without a car. The downtown core and major neighborhoods are very walkable, and taxis are widely available throughout the city.

weather.description: Deep winter with heavy snowfall and biting cold; dress in layers and expect icy sidewalks.
Still firmly winter with frequent snow and frigid temperatures; indoor attractions are a welcome refuge.
Late winter begins to ease slightly but snow and cold persist; slush and ice are common underfoot.
Spring arrives tentatively with cool temperatures and a mix of rain and lingering snow early in the month.
Pleasant spring weather with warming temperatures and blooming parks; occasional showers are normal.
Warm and lively with long daylight hours; festival season begins and outdoor terraces fill up.
Peak summer with warm, humid days and occasional thunderstorms; the city buzzes with festivals and outdoor events.
Hot and humid with the feel of high summer; afternoon thunderstorms are possible but evenings are lively outdoors.
Comfortable early autumn with cooler evenings and the start of spectacular fall foliage.
Crisp autumn weather with brilliant fall colors; temperatures drop noticeably toward month's end.
Cold and grey with the first snowflakes possible; the city transitions into its winter rhythm.
Cold winter sets in with regular snowfall; festive holiday markets and indoor cultural events brighten the season.
